p: RNA/DNA free water was used as the negative control, whereas for the positive control, a YFV gene fragment (5â€™-NC [ 17]) cloned into the pGemP plasmid (Promega, Madison, WI, USA) was used. The quantification of viral RNA from YFV infected mosquitoes were performed in comparison with serial dilution (from 10 7 to 1 copy of viral RNA) of a standard curve ( Table S1) of the same gene used as the positive control. Therefore, it was possible to calculate the number of RNA copies per sample [ 18]. The limit of detection was on the order of 100 copies that corresponded to a Ct value of 36.
